content.description: Ascend a ramp and make the crux move(s) by stepping right around the arete edge to a ramp where a series of bolts leads to the anchors.  The straight-up option is substantially more difficult and not recommended but, due to the location of the protection, doable.
content.location: A few feet downhill and to the left of the starts to Time to Power and Shipwreck.

content.description: The first pitch to Time To Power is only mentioned in Watt's book as something where "you have to plow through an ugly approach pitch to get to the real [5.12c] climbing". Occasional ascents during the last decade on the sparsely placed bolts has improved this pitch to "fun for some" status.   The standard, straight-up start to reach the high on the wall first bolt can be made a bit easier by using a modest ramp system just uphill and to the right of the direct start.  The somewhat tricky crux is protected by the second bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts on first pitch. Two bolt anchor (could/should be improved if pitch gets more traffic).
content.location: Just uphill from Time To Shower and Shipwreck.

content.description:
Time to Power ascends the attractive East Ship face in between the Aggro gully and Ship Wreck gully. A wild & varied route unusual of Smith Rocks. Features everything from difficult slab climbing on flawless red stone to long moves through a pumping overhang. The crux is typical of most 5.12s at smith, near vert, on bad holds.  

  Other difficulties include waiting for an opportunity to climb the route, as the bottom portion of this route has become quite popular.
content.protection: There's a somewhat difficult clip part way up the upper scoop. It's best just to skip it. It's best to approach this route as a single push from the ground. Be aware! A 70 meter rope will barely reach the ground.

content.description: The first pitch of Shipwreck can be fun but the upper pitches are to be avoided.  Ascend the shared start of Time To Shower until you reach the crack system that starts in a small book.  Use the crack and work your way up to and through the junky section to the anchors of the first pitch of Time To Power.  Bring your second up or lower to the ground and top-rope the second so they can clean the route.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches.  Two bolt anchor.
content.location: Shipwreck is the upward and rightward curving crack between Time To Shower and Time To Power on East Ship River Face.

content.description: Well-protected climbing leads to a perplexing corner culminating in a bulge. Pull up and left on sloping edges, then continue up the decreasing angle until you reach the chains atop a low angle slab.This is a new route, with some loose rock remaining. The route is cleaning up, but upper portions of the climb require some choice footing. Make sure everyone at the base is wearing a helmet.
content.location: Furthest left route on the river face.

content.description: Ascends a short slab to a small overhanging bulge.  Continues up on less than vertical terrain to new anchors right of Time to Power 1st pitch finish.  Route is new, use caution as there is still some loose rock in places.
content.protection: 6 bolts, anchors: chains with steel carabiners
content.location: Shipwreck Wall River Face- just uphill and to the right of Time to Power.

content.description: The prominent buttress to the right of Aggro Gully.  West Ship is its brother buttress.  Because much of the rock on the face of this buttress is less than optimal few routes are found on it but the few that are there are worth checking out.
